references: Simulation parameters, if not otherwise specified, are reported in Table I. In particular, some additional information should be provided:

The total number of FL iterations, X𝑋X, is not fixed a priori (and thus it does not appear in Table I) since it depends on the specific settings of a given simulation run, such as the number of UEs, the model size, the considered retransmission policy, etc.;

S6.T2.caption: TABLE II: Conditions under which CB for NR PUSCH with retransmissions on dedicated resources provides lower model upload times w.r.t DS as a function of the model size PFLsubscript𝑃FLP_{\rm FL} and maximum bandwidth allowed for CB transmissions BCBsubscript𝐵CBB_{\rm CB} when considering NFL=subscript𝑁FLabsentN_{\rm FL}= 30.
S6.T2.table:
PFLsubscript𝑃FLP_{\rm FL} [kB]
𝟏1\mathbf{1} 𝟖8\mathbf{8} 𝟏𝟐12\mathbf{12} 𝟏𝟔16\mathbf{16}
BCBsubscript𝐵CBB_{\rm CB} [MHz] 𝟓5\mathbf{5} YES NO NO NO
𝟏𝟎10\mathbf{10} YES YES YES (up to 5 UEs) NO
𝟐𝟎20\mathbf{20} YES YES YES (up to 20 UEs) NO
𝟒𝟎40\mathbf{40} YES YES YES NO
references: To explain the reasons behind the choice of 12 and 16 kB as the FL model sizes for Figs. 2a and 2c, Table II shows the conditions under which CB for NR PUSCH with retransmissions on dedicated resources provides lower model upload times w.r.t DS as a function of the model size, PFLsubscript𝑃FLP_{\rm FL}, and maximum bandwidth allowed for CB transmissions BCBsubscript𝐵CBB_{\rm CB} (out of the overall system bandwidth B𝐵B) when considering NFL=subscript𝑁FLabsentN_{\rm FL}= 30. As can be seen, independently of the considered BCBsubscript𝐵CBB_{\rm CB} value, a model size of 12 kB is the maximum value for which the considered CB design provides benefits over DS, thereby motivating the model size choice of Fig. 2a. Of course, the same holds for the model download times, i.e., 16 kB is the maximum model size for which there are gains, as well as when considering the design employing retransmissions on CB resources.

S6.T3.caption: TABLE III: Average collision probability and average iteration time as a function of the number of FL UEs, when considering the model size of 2 MB, and the considered CB approach for NR PUSCH with retransmissions on dedicated resources.
S6.T3.table:
NFLsubscript𝑁FLN_{\rm FL} pC¯¯superscript𝑝C\overline{p^{\rm C}} τI¯¯superscript𝜏I\overline{\tau^{\rm I}} [s]
1 0 20.2498

10 0.0426 25.1477
15 0.0649 29.6163

25 0.1017 37.2457
30 0.1238 42.4982
references: Next, in Table III we show the average collision probability, pC¯¯superscript𝑝C\overline{p^{\rm C}}, and average iteration time, τI¯¯superscript𝜏I\overline{\tau^{\rm I}}, when considering the model size of 2 MB, and the considered CB for NR PUSCH with retransmissions on dedicated resources. It can be seen that the average iteration times can be tens of seconds even for low loads, thus indicating that a FL training can be quite large if it involved higher loads (i.e., a non-negligible training phase has to be performed before having FL-based cameras ready to perform image recognition).
